text: Nadia Akpana Assa (born 22 December 1995 in Oslo) is a Norwegian athlete specialising in the long jump. She won the silver medal at the 2014 World Junior Championships. Her parents came to Norway from Togo in the mid-1980s.Sikter mot verdenstoppen (in Norwegian) Her personal bests in the event are 6.53 metres outdoors (+0.4 m/s, Copenhagen 2016) and 6.37 metres indoors (Bærum 2016). ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2013 |European Junior Championships |Rieti, Italy |19th (q) |Long jump |5.96 m |- |2014 |World Junior Championships |Eugene, United States |bgcolor=silver|2nd |Long jump |6.31 m |- |rowspan=2|2015 |European Indoor Championships |Prague, Czech Republic |19th (q) |Long jump |6.08 m |- |European U23 Championships |Tallinn, Estonia |8th |Long jump |6.42 m |- |2016 |European Championships |Amsterdam, Netherlands |8th |Long jump |6.51 m |- |2017 |European U23 Championships |Bydgoszcz, Poland |8th |Long jump |6.29 m (w) |} ==References== Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Norwegian people of Togolese descent Category:Norwegian female long jumpers Category:Sportspeople from Oslo
title: Nadia Akpana Assa
